elements.title: Pre-Populated Listing Confirmation Card
elements.description: A single-screen confirmation card that displays all listing data captured from an agent call. Each field shows a label, pre-filled value, and a check icon indicating confirmed status. Fields can be toggled to edit mode by clicking the value. Missing items (photos) are highlighted. A single 'Looks Good' button confirms the entire listing. Designed for passive hosts who should scan and approve in under 60 seconds.
elements.html_css_snippet:
Based on your call with Bryant

Your Listing Details

157 W 80th St, New York, NY

Monthly Rent $3,000
Security Deposit $3,000
Utilities Included
Laundry Offsite nearby
Parking Street + paid garage
Availability Jun 1 - Aug 30
Photos Needed - text to Bryant

Details auto-confirm in 48 hours if no changes are made

elements.title: Crowd Range Pricing Indicator
elements.description: A minimal horizontal bar that shows the host's price relative to comparable listings in their area. The host's price is displayed prominently above the bar, with the crowd range shown as a thin bar below. A position marker indicates where the host's price falls within the range. No recommendations, no judgments -- pure informational context. Designed to be scannable in under 3 seconds.
elements.html_css_snippet:
Your Price
$3,000 /month
$2,600 $3,400

Similar spaces near W 80th St list for $2,600 - $3,400/mo.

elements.title: SMS Notification Preview Card (Agent Dashboard)
elements.description: A card in the agent dashboard showing how an SMS will appear to the host, using the CATEGORY/fact/action three-line structure. Includes send button, delivery status indicator, and response tracking. The card renders the SMS template with platform typography to maintain design system consistency while previewing the actual text the host will receive.
elements.html_css_snippet:
Anthony - 157 W 80th St
Ready
Listing
Your listing at 157 W 80th St is ready for review. $3,000/mo, utilities included.

Responded
Check-in

Reply GOOD or HELP.
Host Reply
GOOD
Replied 2h ago

elements.title: Host Engagement Spectrum (Agent Dashboard)
elements.description: A portfolio overview component for the agent dashboard showing all managed hosts with their engagement level encoded as a purple-to-gray gradient indicator. Four states: Active (solid purple), Moderate (half-filled), Passive (quarter-filled), Silent (empty outline). Each host row shows the engagement indicator, host name, property address, key status, and pending actions. Sorted by engagement level (Silent first, to surface at-risk hosts).

elements.title: Co-Host Mode Activation SMS Flow
elements.description: A visual representation of the Co-Host Mode SMS activation flow as seen from the agent dashboard. Shows the activation request card, the pending state while awaiting host reply, and the confirmed state after the host replies YES. Demonstrates the single-tap activation principle: one SMS, one reply, full co-host access.
elements.html_css_snippet:
Step 1: Agent Initiates
A

Anthony

157 W 80th St

No Co-Host
"Would you like Bryant to manage your listing for you? Reply YES to give access. Reply STOP anytime to manage directly."
Step 2: Awaiting Host Reply
A

Anthony

157 W 80th St

Pending

SMS sent 2 hours ago

Step 3: Co-Host Active
A

Anthony

157 W 80th St

Co-Host Active
Edit listing details and description
Upload photos on behalf of host
Respond to guest inquiries
Accept proposals (with host SMS confirmation)

Host can reply STOP to any notification to revoke access

elements.title: Monthly Host Summary SMS (Platform Rendering)
elements.description: The platform's internal rendering of a monthly SMS summary sent to a passive host. Shows how the concise SMS text maps to the design system's typography and color tokens. Demonstrates the 'invisible competence' principle: one message that communicates rent received, no issues, and delegated actions -- everything is handled. Includes the SMS as the host would see it (phone mockup) and the platform's internal record (dashboard card).

elements.title: Silence Check-In SMS States
elements.description: A dashboard component showing the three states of the silence interpretation check-in: scheduled, sent (awaiting response), and categorized (GOOD, HELP, or No Response). Demonstrates how one-bit signals from passive hosts are captured and categorized for the retention model. Each state card shows the SMS content, timing, and the resulting host classification.
